required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinic-based Intervention to Promote Cervical Cancer Prevention Behaviors
clinical_study.official_title: Step up to Prevention : A Nurse Practitioner Guided Cervical Cancer Prevention Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: The project is a clinical behavioral research project based at University of Pennsylvania. The goal of this research is to design a brief clinic-based, Nurse Practitioner-guided, and theory-based health promotion intervention to enhance cervical cancer prevention among young women ages 18-26 living in economically disadvantaged urban communities. The investigators will evaluate the intervention for feasibility, acceptability and preliminary efficacy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: For each participant, at end of first study visit. Will assess until all subjects enrolled in study.

arm_group.description: Participant receives an individual computer-delivered information session and participant is offered the HPV vaccine only by their nurse practitioner in clinic.
Participant receives a one-on-one tailored educational session with a trained study team member and participant is offered the HPV vaccine only by their nurse practitioner in clinic.

Participant receives both the knowledge session and the tailored belief sessions and the participant is offered the HPV vaccine only by their nurse practitioner in clinic. This combined intervention is call Step Up to Prevention.
Participant is offered the HPV vaccine only by their nurse practitioner in clinic.

intervention.description: Participant receives a one-on-one tailored educational session with a trained study team member and participant is offered the HPV vaccine only by their nurse practitioner in clinic.
Participant receives an individual computer-delivered information session and participant is offered the HPV vaccine only by their nurse practitioner in clinic.
Participant receives a one-on-one tailored educational session with a trained study team member and participant is offered the HPV vaccine only by their nurse practitioner in clinic.
Participant is offered the HPV vaccine only by their nurse practitioner in clinic.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-26 years
- Not yet received the HPV vaccine
- Speak, read, and understand 5th grade level of English;
- Had vaginal sex with a male partner in the past 2 months.
Exclusion Criteria:
â€¢ Currently pregnant and/or plan to be pregnant in next 6 months

facility.name: Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania, Outpatient Ob/GYN clinic

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were recruited from 2 sites, both with federally-supported family planning programs.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All participants completed a baseline survey prior to randomization.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
